q: Unless a man is master of his soul, all other kinds of mastery amount to little.
h:
“Unless a man is master of his soul, all other kinds of mastery amount to little.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: Knowing others is wisdom, knowing yourself is enlightenment.
h:
“Knowing others is wisdom, knowing yourself is enlightenment.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Even if our home burns down we can rebuild it. But the things that we got for nothing, we can never replace.
h:
“Even if our home burns down we can rebuild it. But the things that we got for nothing, we can never replace.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is God's gift, that's why we call it the present.
h:
“Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is God's gift, that's why we call it the present.” —
Joan Rivers

q: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
h:
“In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.” —
Robert Frost

q: Work is always an antidote to depression.
h:
“Work is always an antidote to depression.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: People seldom do what they believe in. They do what is convenient, then repent.
h:
“People seldom do what they believe in. They do what is convenient, then repent.” —
Bob Dylan

q: Have a heart that never hardens, and a temper that never tires, and a touch that never hurts.
h:
“Have a heart that never hardens, and a temper that never tires, and a touch that never hurts.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.
h:
“Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.” —
Epictetus

q: The wisest men follow their own direction.
h:
“The wisest men follow their own direction.” —
Euripides

q: Yesterday is but today's memory, tomorrow is today's dream.
h:
“Yesterday is but today's memory, tomorrow is today's dream.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: Unless you're ashamed of yourself now and then, you're not honest.
h:
“Unless you're ashamed of yourself now and then, you're not honest.” —
William Faulkner

q: Just try to be the best you can be; never cease trying to be the best you can be. That's in your power.
h:
“Just try to be the best you can be; never cease trying to be the best you can be. That's in your power.” —
John Wooden

q: Life is too short to waste your time on people who don't respect, appreciate, and value you.
h:
“Life is too short to waste your time on people who don't respect, appreciate, and value you.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Your very silence shows you agree.
h:
“Your very silence shows you agree.” —
Euripides

q: Constantly think about how you could be doing things better.
h:
“Constantly think about how you could be doing things better.” —
Elon Musk

q: Our truest life is when we are in dreams awake.
h:
“Our truest life is when we are in dreams awake.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: It is the greatest of all mistakes to do nothing because you can only do little; do something.
h:
“It is the greatest of all mistakes to do nothing because you can only do little; do something.” —
Sydney Smith

q: Quiet people have the loudest minds.
h:
“Quiet people have the loudest minds.” —
Stephen Hawking

q: If you are lucky enough to find love, remember it is there and don't throw it away.
h:
“If you are lucky enough to find love, remember it is there and don't throw it away.” —
Stephen Hawking

q: Life is a question and how we live it is our answer.
h:
“Life is a question and how we live it is our answer.” —
Gary Keller

q: There are two ways of seeing: with the body and with the soul. The body's sight can sometimes forget, but the soul remembers forever.
h:
“There are two ways of seeing: with the body and with the soul. The body's sight can sometimes forget, but the soul remembers forever.” —
Alexandre Dumas

q: Trust your instincts: my first reaction is almost invariably the right one.
h:
“Trust your instincts: my first reaction is almost invariably the right one. ” —
Estee Lauder

q: There is no such thing as a great talent without great willpower.
h:
“There is no such thing as a great talent without great willpower.” —
Honore de Balzac

q: Accept responsibility for your life. Know that it is you who will get you where you want to go, no one else.
h:
“Accept responsibility for your life. Know that it is you who will get you where you want to go, no one else.” —
Les Brown

q: Conscience is a man's compass.
h:
“Conscience is a man's compass. ” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: I succeeded by saying what everyone else is thinking.
h:
“I succeeded by saying what everyone else is thinking.” —
Joan Rivers

q: Nothing will work unless you do.
h:
“Nothing will work unless you do.” —
Maya Angelou

q: We must be free not because we claim freedom, but because we practice it.
h:
“We must be free not because we claim freedom, but because we practice it.” —
William Faulkner

q: The older you get, the more you understand how your conscience works.
h:
“The older you get, the more you understand how your conscience works.” —
Criss Jami

q: It takes half your life before you discover life is a do-it-yourself project.
h:
“It takes half your life before you discover life is a do-it-yourself project.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: Rich people have small TVs and big libraries, and poor people have small libraries and big TVs.
h:
“Rich people have small TVs and big libraries, and poor people have small libraries and big TVs.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: It's better to dance than to march through life.
h:
“It's better to dance than to march through life.” —
Yoko Ono

q: Chop your own wood and it will warm you twice.
h:
“Chop your own wood and it will warm you twice. ” —
Henry Ford

q: When it comes to mastering a skill, time is the magic ingredient.
h:
“When it comes to mastering a skill, time is the magic ingredient.” —
Robert Greene

q: Natural talent only determines the limits of your athletic potential. It's dedication and a willingness to discipline your life that makes you great.
h:
“Natural talent only determines the limits of your athletic potential. It's dedication and a willingness to discipline your life that makes you great.” —
Billie Jean King

q: Because a thing seems difficult for you, do not think it impossible.
h:
“Because a thing seems difficult for you, do not think it impossible.” —
Marcus Aurelius

q: The friend is the man who knows all about you, and still likes you.
h:
“The friend is the man who knows all about you, and still likes you.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: The golden opportunity you are seeking is in yourself. It is not in your environment; it is not in luck or chance, or the help of others; it is in yourself alone.
h:
“The golden opportunity you are seeking is in yourself. It is not in your environment; it is not in luck or chance, or the help of others; it is in yourself alone. ” —
Orison Swett Marden

q: A mistake is only an error, it becomes a mistake when you fail to correct it.
h:
“A mistake is only an error, it becomes a mistake when you fail to correct it.” —
John Lennon

q: Whereever you are, you are one with the clouds and one with the sun and the stars you see. You are one with everything.
h:
“Whereever you are, you are one with the clouds and one with the sun and the stars you see. You are one with everything.” —
Shunryu Suzuki

q: There is no greatness where there is not simplicity, goodness, and truth.
h:
“There is no greatness where there is not simplicity, goodness, and truth.” —
Leo Tolstoy

q: Success is good at any age, but the sooner you find it, the longer you will enjoy it.
h:
“Success is good at any age, but the sooner you find it, the longer you will enjoy it.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: The mind can calculate, but the spirit yearns, and the heart wants what the heart wants.
h:
“The mind can calculate, but the spirit yearns, and the heart wants what the heart wants.” —
Stephen King

q: Welcome every morning with a smile. Look on the new day as another gift from your Creator, another golden opportunity.
h:
“Welcome every morning with a smile. Look on the new day as another gift from your Creator, another golden opportunity.” —
Og Mandino

q: Every traveler has a home of his own, and he learns to appreciate it the more from his wandering.
h:
“Every traveler has a home of his own, and he learns to appreciate it the more from his wandering.” —
Charles Dickens

q: The world doesn't always give you want, but it often gives you what you need.
h:
“The world doesn't always give you want, but it often gives you what you need.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: You change the world by being yourself.
h:
“You change the world by being yourself.” —
Yoko Ono

q: If you aren't sure which way to do something, do it both ways and see which works better.
h:
“If you aren't sure which way to do something, do it both ways and see which works better.” —
John Carmack

q: Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goals.
h:
“Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goals.” —
Sydney Smith
